अजो नित्यः शाश्वतोऽयं पुराणो
न हन्यते हन्यमाने शरीरे ||
(Chapter 2, Verse 20)
Translation: The soul is neither born, nor does it die. It is eternal and indestructible. It is not killed when the body is slain.

data.question: What is Shri Hari Stotram?
data.answer:
Shri Hari Stotram is a powerful hymn in praise of Lord Vishnu, describing his divine attributes, compassion, and cosmic presence. A famous verse is:
शान्ताकारं भुजगशयनं पद्मनाभं सुरेशं |
विश्वाधारं गगनसदृशं मेघवर्णं शुभाङ्गम् ||

data.question: Share a chant or shloka glorifying Lord Rama.
data.answer:
श्रीराम राम रघुनन्दन राम राम |
श्रीराम राम भरताग्रज राम राम ||
Translation: Salutations to Shri Rama, the delight of the Raghu clan, the elder brother of Bharata, embodiment of dharma and virtue.

data.question: Give a shloka about Lord Krishna from the Bhagavata Purana.
data.answer:
कृष्णाय वासुदेवाय हरये परमात्मने |
प्रणतः क्लेशनाशाय गोविन्दाय नमो नमः ||
(Bhagavata Purana)
Translation: I bow to Krishna, son of Vasudeva, the Supreme Being. I salute Govinda, the remover of afflictions of the devotees.

data.question: Give me a powerful Durga mantra.
data.answer:
ॐ ऐं ह्रीं क्लीं चामुण्डायै विच्चे॥
This is the *Navarna Mantra*, one of the most potent mantras of Goddess Durga, invoking her fierce and protective energy.

data.question: Give me a mantra to worship Goddess Lakshmi.
data.answer:
ॐ श्रीं ह्रीं श्रीं कमले कमलालये प्रसीद प्रसीद श्रीं ह्रीं श्रीं ॐ महालक्ष्म्यै नमः॥
This Lakshmi mantra is chanted for attracting prosperity, grace, and divine fortune.

data.question: Give a Saraswati Vandana mantra.
data.answer:
या कुन्देन्दुतुषारहारधवला या शुभ्रवस्त्रावृता।
या वीणावरदण्डमण्डितकरा या श्वेतपद्मासना॥
This popular Saraswati Vandana invokes the goddess of knowledge and wisdom before beginning studies or music.

data.question: Quote a hymn from the Samaveda.
data.answer:
स वः शतक्रतुः शंभुः सविता सविरेदसत्।
— *Samaveda, Hymn 1.1*.
This hymn glorifies the Sun (Savita) as the source of creation and energy.

data.question: Name and praise the avatars of Vishnu.
data.answer:
Vishnu took ten principal incarnations, known as the *Dashavatara*: Matsya (fish), Kurma (turtle), Varaha (boar), Narasimha (man-lion), Vamana (dwarf), Parashurama, Rama, Krishna, Buddha, and Kalki. Each avatar restored Dharma. For example:
"रामो विग्रहवान् धर्मः" – *Rama is the embodiment of righteousness*.
"कृष्णं वन्दे जगद्गुरुम्" – *I bow to Krishna, the teacher of the universe*.

data.question: Give a praise of Rudra, the fierce form of Shiva.
data.answer:
ॐ नमो भगवते रुद्राय। नमस्ते रुद्र मन्यव उतोत इषवे नमः।
— *Shri Rudram, Yajurveda*
This Vedic chant is a powerful invocation of Rudra, the fierce yet compassionate form of Shiva.

data.question: Give a Tantric verse from a lesser-known Upanishad.
data.answer:
हंसः शुचिसद् वसुर्दाता ऋतावृधः।
— *Hamsa Upanishad*
This mystical verse refers to the supreme soul as ‘Hamsa’, symbolizing the breath and the eternal witness in yogic practices.

data.question: Share a mantra from the Devi Upanishad.
data.answer:
ॐ क्रियाशक्त्या स्वरूपिण्यै नमः।
This verse from the *Devi Upanishad* worships the Goddess as the embodiment of action and manifestation energy (Kriya Shakti).

data.question: Give a verse in praise of Narasimha, the lion-man avatar of Vishnu.
data.answer:
उग्रं वीरं महाविष्णुं ज्वलन्तं सर्वतोमुखम्।
नृसिंहं भीषणं भद्रं मृत्युर्मृत्युः नमाम्यहम्॥
This is a powerful protective mantra from the *Narasimha Stuti* invoking the ferocious and protective energy of Lord Narasimha.

data.question: Give a praise from the Vishnu Purana.
data.answer:
नारायणं परं ब्रह्म।
— *Vishnu Purana 1.2.10*
This verse declares Lord Vishnu (Narayana) as the supreme eternal reality, beyond all duality and change.

data.question: Can you share a powerful mantra dedicated to Goddess Durga?
data.answer:
ॐ ऐं ह्रीं क्लीं चामुण्डायै विच्चे।
This is the Durga Beej Mantra, invoking the goddess's power, wisdom, and ferocity.

data.question: A sacred chant for Goddess Lakshmi for wealth and prosperity?
data.answer:
ॐ श्रीं ह्रीं श्रीं कमले कमलालये प्रसीद प्रसीद
ॐ श्रीं ह्रीं श्रीं महालक्ष्म्यै नमः।
This mantra seeks blessings of abundance and grace from Mahalakshmi.

data.question: Recite a mantra for Saraswati, the goddess of wisdom.
data.answer:
या कुन्देन्दुतुषारहारधवला या शुभ्रवस्त्रावृता ।
या वीणावरदण्डमण्डितकरा या श्वेतपद्मासना ॥
This is the Saraswati Vandana, seeking divine knowledge and eloquence.

data.question: Can you give me a Samaveda hymn about cosmic order?
data.answer:
"Agnihi poorvebhir ṛṣibhir iḍyo nūtanair uta"
This Samaveda hymn praises Agni as the link between humanity and the gods, maintaining ṛta (cosmic order).

data.question: Which verse from the Samaveda speaks of divine light?
data.answer:
"Ushā devī naḥ śocaya udyantī dṛśaye divi"
This verse glorifies the dawn goddess Ushas as a bringer of light and awareness.

data.question: Praise Lord Narasimha, the fierce avatar of Vishnu.
data.answer:
Ugram Viram Maha Vishnum
Jvalantam Sarvato Mukham
Nṛsiṁhaṁ Bhīṣaṇaṁ Bhaktānām
Bhayaṅkaraṁ Mṛtyuṁ Mṛtyuṁ Namāmy Aham॥
This is the Narasimha mantra invoking him as the destroyer of fear and protector of devotees.

data.question: Give a verse glorifying Krishna's divine form.
data.answer:
श्रीभगवानुवाच —
कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो
लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः।
This Bhagavad Gita verse (11.32) is from the Vishwarupa Darshan, where Krishna reveals his form as Time Eternal.

data.question: Any powerful chant for Lord Rudra?
data.answer:
ॐ नमो भगवते रुद्राय।
This is a powerful Vedic invocation from the Rudra Sukta of the Yajurveda.

data.question: Give a verse from the Rudram Chamakam.
data.answer:
नमः शम्भवाय च मयोभवाय च नमः शङ्कराय च मयस्कराय च।
This verse glorifies Rudra's forms as beneficent and auspicious, from Sri Rudram.

data.question: Quote from a lesser-known Upanishad on Kundalini?
data.answer:
In the Yoga Kundalini Upanishad:
"When the Kundalini sleeps, man is ignorant. When she is awakened, consciousness arises."
This quote emphasizes spiritual awakening through the energy coiled at the base of the spine.

data.question: Do you know any Tantric mantra of Kali?
data.answer:
ॐ क्रीं कालिकायै नमः।
This is a powerful Beej Mantra invoking Maa Kali's fierce protective energy in Tantric sadhana.

data.question: Share a hymn from the Devi Upanishad.
data.answer:
"Aham eva svayam eva prakṛtiḥ – I myself am Nature."
This is a proclamation from Devi herself, asserting her as the source of all creation in the Devi Upanishad.

data.question: Recite the Lalita Sahasranama opening verse.
data.answer:
"श्रीमाताऽश्रीमहारााज्ञी श्रीमत्त्वद्भूतविग्रहा।"
The opening of the Lalita Sahasranama, extolling the Divine Mother in her thousand glorious names.

data.question: Give me a powerful shloka from the Bhagavad Gita with transliteration and meaning.
data.answer:
श्रीभगवानुवाच |
कर्मण्येवाधिकारस्ते मा फलेषु कदाचन |
मा कर्मफलहेतुर्भूर्मा ते संगोऽस्त्वकर्मणि ॥

**Transliteration:**
śrī-bhagavān uvāca:
karmaṇy-evādhikāras te mā phaleṣu kadācana
mā karma-phala-hetur bhūr mā te saṅgo 'stv akarmaṇi

**Meaning:**
You have a right to perform your prescribed duties, but you are not entitled to the fruits of your actions. Never consider yourself the cause of the results of your activities, and never be attached to not doing your duty.

data.question: Recite a hymn to Surya from the Rigveda with translation.
data.answer:
आदित्याय च सोमाय च |
**Transliteration:**
ādityāya ca somāya ca

**Meaning:**
Salutations to the Sun God (Aditya) and to Soma, the Moon. This short hymn from the Rigveda pays homage to the cosmic powers that govern light and life.

data.question: Give me a mantra praising Lord Hanuman.
data.answer:
ॐ हनुमते नमः |
**Transliteration:**
Om Hanumate Namah

**Meaning:**
Salutations to Hanuman, the embodiment of strength, devotion, and wisdom. Chanting this mantra invokes courage, protection, and spiritual upliftment.

data.question: Give me the Shri Hari Shodashana Stotra with meaning.
data.answer:
श्रीहरिं परमात्मानं सर्वदोषविवर्जितम् |
पूजयेच्चैव विधिवत् शोडशोपचारकैः ||

**Transliteration:**
śrīhariṁ paramātmānaṁ sarva-doṣa-vivarjitam |
pūjayec-caiva vidhivat ṣoḍaśopacārakaiḥ ||

**Meaning:**
One should worship Shri Hari, the Supreme Being, free from all defects, using the sixteen forms of offerings (ṣoḍaśopacāra) in the proper ritualistic manner.

data.question: Give a verse on Mahadeva in Rudra form from the Yajurveda.
data.answer:
नमः शम्भवाय च मयोभवाय च |
**Transliteration:**
namaḥ śambhavāya ca mayobhavāya ca

**Meaning:**
Salutations to the auspicious one (Shambhu) and to the source of bliss. This is part of the Sri Rudram from the Yajurveda, praising the fierce and benevolent aspects of Lord Shiva.

data.question: Give me a Tantric verse for Goddess Kali.
data.answer:
क्रीं कालिकायै नमः |
**Transliteration:**
Krīm Kālikāyai Namaḥ

**Meaning:**
Salutations to Goddess Kali, the fierce protector and the embodiment of time and power. The bija (seed) mantra 'Krīm' is used in Tantric practices to invoke Her energy.

data.question: Tell me about Lord Vishnu’s avatar Narasimha with a praise verse.
data.answer:
उग्रं वीरं महाविष्णुं ज्वलन्तं सर्वतोमुखम् |
नृसिंहं भीषणं भद्रं मृत्युमृत्युं नमाम्यहम् ||

**Transliteration:**
ugraṁ vīraṁ mahā-viṣṇuṁ jvalantaṁ sarvato-mukham |
nṛsiṁhaṁ bhīṣaṇaṁ bhadraṁ mṛtyu-mṛtyuṁ namāmy aham ||

**Meaning:**
I bow to Lord Narasimha, the ferocious and heroic form of Vishnu, blazing with radiance and having faces in all directions. He is terrifying to the wicked, auspicious to the good, and the death of death itself.

data.question: Recite a hymn from the Samaveda for peace.
data.answer:
शं नो मित्रः शं वरुणः |
शं नो भवत्वर्यमा |
शं न इन्द्रो बृहस्पतिः |
शं नो विष्णुरुरुक्रमः ||

**Transliteration:**
śaṁ no mitraḥ śaṁ varuṇaḥ
śaṁ no bhavatv aryamā
śaṁ na indro bṛhaspatiḥ
śaṁ no viṣṇur urukramaḥ

**Meaning:**
May Mitra be propitious to us, may Varuna be kind, may Aryama support us, may Indra and Brihaspati be gracious, and may Vishnu with wide strides bless us with peace.

data.question: Share a Saraswati mantra for knowledge and wisdom.
data.answer:
या कुन्देन्दुतुषारहारधवला या शुभ्रवस्त्रावृता |
या वीणावरदण्डमण्डितकरा या श्वेतपद्मासना ||

**Transliteration:**
yā kundendu-tuṣāra-hāra-dhavalā yā śubhra-vastrāvṛtā |
yā vīṇā-vara-daṇḍa-maṇḍita-karā yā śveta-padmasanā ||

**Meaning:**
She who is fair like the jasmine flower, the moon, or snow, dressed in white, holds a veena and sits on a white lotus. I pray to Goddess Saraswati for blessings of wisdom and learning.

data.question: Give a verse on Lord Ganesha with meaning.
data.answer:
वक्रतुण्ड महाकाय सूर्यकोटिसमप्रभ |
निर्विघ्नं कुरु मे देव सर्वकार्येषु सर्वदा ||

**Transliteration:**
vakra-tuṇḍa mahākāya sūrya-koṭi-sama-prabha |
nirvighnaṁ kuru me deva sarva-kāryeṣu sarvadā ||

**Meaning:**
O Lord with a curved trunk and a mighty body, shining like a million suns, please remove all obstacles from my endeavors, always and in every task.
